Authors:
Bianca Denise Silva, Tiara Sousa Cabral, Paulo Sérgio
Marinho, Iuri Goulart Baseia
Title: Two new species of Geastrum found in Brazil
Abstract:
We have studied molecular and morphological data of
Geastrum aculeatum sp. nov. and G. echinulatum sp. nov. These two
species were found in Brazilâs semi-arid region and in Central Amazonia,
and they are characterized by the nature of the mycelial layer with
aculeate tuffs. Geastrum echinulatum differs from G. aculeatum in the
size of the spores, presence of subiculum, and structural details in the
mycelial tuffs. The phylogenetic analyses were performed through
parsimony and Bayesian methods, using the atp6 and LSU regions. These
analyses confirm that both species are distinctly segregated from the
other Geastrum species analyzed here.
